Comments: NYMR: Lat. given as 27-07, possibly should be 47-07. 2 bergs, the larger being long and flat.

NYMR, also J. Hennessy, Marine Observer, Vol 9, 1932, pp 76-80; 2' high and 30 or 40' in circumference.  "This is the furthest south ice has been seen in many years." HB 1380 Feb 9: passed a hummock of ice ~2' high & 40' in circumference
